meaningMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an い on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>solid</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>solid</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>serious</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>upright</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>hard</vocabulary>. This word is often used in the figurative sense, as in a solid defence, a serious topic, or an upright person.
